title: Pope Francis Decries Chasing #039;likes#039; on Social Media
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
28 Sep 2015 04:54 AM EST 
Referring to the rise of social media's popularity, Pope Francis said to an audience of American bishops at Saint Charles Borromeo Seminary, "I would dare say that at the root of so many contemporary situations is a kind of radical loneliness that so many people live in today -- Running after the latest fad, a like, accumulating followers on any of the social networks." The Pope has more than 7.4 million Twitter followers on his English-language account, but that doesn't mean he's chasing more. He continued, "Today consumerism determines what is important, consuming relationships, consuming friendships, consuming religions."
